items.title: Super Mario Galaxy + Mario Galaxy 2 hits best price yet if you’re quick (Nearly 35% off), more
items.summary:
As we detailed this morning, Woot launched a particularly notable gaming gear sale that delivers a bonus 20% in savings on top of the already marked down prices using code LEVEL20 at checkout. But you better get in there quick as some gear and select Switch games have already sold out. One highlight here is now the new Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 for Switch (also playable on Switch 2) that falls to $47.19 Prime shipped. Regularly $70, this is nearly 35% off the list price and one of the best we have tracked. But you’ll also find loads of other Switch games in the sale right now, including everything from The Legend of Zelda Link’s Awakening and Pokémon Legends: Z-A to Mario Switch classics, and much more. Get in there while you still can. 

Massive Woot gaming sale is back: Up to 85% off Razer gear, Switch/PS5 games, more from just $8 (Extra 20% off today only)

items.title: Heads up! Rare deal drops Samsung’s 4TB T5 EVO portable drive to $299 while SSD prices continue to surge ($281 off)
items.summary:
SSD deals have been pretty hard to find lately, with prices continuing to rise in 2026 amid the ongoing global memory shortage. That’s exactly why you might want to jump in and snag this deal that gets you Samsung’s 4TB T5 EVO portable SSD for $299 shipped. For context, Samsung currently lists the 4TB model at a steep $580 on its online store, so you’re saving a massive $281 with this Walmart deal. It’s also the lowest price we’ve tracked for this drive in recent months, making it a standout option when most 4TB SSDs are still hovering north of $400 at Amazon and other retailers. Even SanDisk’s new Extreme Pro is priced significantly higher at around $920 right now, which makes this an absolute steal. This is about as good as it gets right now if you’ve been waiting to grab a high-capacity portable SSD, so grab it after getting more details below.

more…

Amazon is currently offering a Lightning sale on the Razor Rambler 16 e-bike for $525 shipped in its black colorway. It’s dropping down from a $700 full price here, which we’ve only seen go as low as $548 over the last year. While we have seen this price beaten out by the $478 Amazon low in the past, that rate hasn’t been seen for two years, making this $175 markdown the best price since on this particular colorway, while the original tan colorway that is no longer available on Amazon has been historically seen as low as $400.
